description: Number of steps needed for modified juggler sequence (A094685) started at n to reach 1.
comments: It is not known if every starting value eventually reaches 1.
references: C. Pickover, Computers and the Imagination, St. Martin's Press, NY, 1991, p. 233.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Richard J Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..836
maple: f:=proc(n) if n mod 2 = 0 then RETURN(round(sqrt(n))) else RETURN(round(n^(3/2))); fi; end; [Corrected by Richard J Mathar, Jul 28 2007]
mathematica: mjs[n_] := If[EvenQ[n], Round[Sqrt[n]], Round[Sqrt[n^3]]]; f[n_] := Length[NestWhileList[mjs, n, # != 1 &]] - 1; Table[ f[n], {n, 90}]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Robert G. Wilson v_, _Mira Bernstein_
extensions: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 09, 2004.
